definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Her hands lay open in her lap and, loosely between them, a rosary .
sentences.chinese: 她的双手摊开放在膝上，一串念珠松松地拿在手间。

sentences.english: When the cards have been folded into one pile, the volunteer spreads them out on the table.
sentences.chinese: 当纸牌折叠成一撂时，志愿者将其摊开在桌子上。

sentences.english: Spread many electronic pads around on the desk, just as you spread out papers.
sentences.chinese: 在桌子上摊开许多的电子式垫子，就好像摊开纸一样。

sentences.english: Spread many electronic pads around on the desk, just as you spread out papers.
sentences.chinese: 在桌子上摊开许多的电子式垫子，就好像摊开纸一样。

sentences.english: And he discovered Yung Mei Ling sprawled on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 他发现容美玲摊开在地板上。

sentences.english: Leave issues of some questionable magazines out in the open.
sentences.chinese: 把一些可疑的期刊杂志摊开放在外面。

sentences.english: Get a page of a broadsheet newspaper, and lay it on your table.
sentences.chinese: 你可以打开一张报纸，摊开放在桌上。

sentences.english: Roll heaped teaspoonfuls of dough into balls. Place on the lined trays about 1 1/2" apart.
sentences.chinese: 辊堆面团成球型，按照一定比例在托盘上摊开。

sentences.english: He spread out his arms and shrugged his shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 他无可奈何地摊开双臂耸了耸肩。

sentences.english: He was sprawled full-length across the bed.
sentences.chinese: 他手脚摊开横躺在床上。

sentences.english: She raised her head and nonchalantly extended her hand, the palm up.
sentences.chinese: 她抬起头，若无其事的摊开手掌，掌心向上。

sentences.english: She opened her hands which held a few dried beans that she had brought from the hamlet over there to feed to the horse.
sentences.chinese: 她摊开捧着从村里要来喂马的豆子的手。

sentences.english: Burke was asleep, sprawled obliviously against the window.
sentences.chinese: 伯克无意识地摊开四肢靠着窗户睡着了。

sentences.english: He left the book open on the library table.
sentences.chinese: 他将书摊开在图书馆的桌子上。

sentences.english: We shook down a straw mattress as an improvised bed.
sentences.chinese: 我们在地上摊开一条草垫作为临时床铺。

sentences.english: Through the seasons, a pool of Su, spread the wonderful life of the feast.
sentences.chinese: 历经四季更迭，一池素荷，摊开了美妙人生的盛宴。

definition: palm (of one's hand)/control (extended meaning from having something in the palm of one's hand)
to hold/to grasp/to clench (one's fist)/to master/classifier: a handful
